name: Holiday Inn Newcastle Upon Tyne

reviews.text: Visited the spa recently with a voucher deal for facial and back massage.
reviews.title: Spa review only

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spa area seemed tired...actual treatment room was nice enough but the toilet was piled high with towels and stock and the waiting area was unprofessional looking.
reviews.title: Great Value on 2-4-1 Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Girls working there were pleasant enough, but seemed inexperienced and clearly hadn't read the information we'd provided them with on the health questionnaires prior to treatments.
reviews.title: Ridiculously expensive wifi but ok hotel

reviews.text: Friend and I were unimpressed with the massages and would actually question whether or not the therapists were fully trained in hot stone or even just normal massage. Facials were better.
reviews.title: Good business stop over

reviews.text: Unlikely to return.
reviews.title: big improvement since last time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is clean, modern, easy to find with plenty of parking.
reviews.title: Good choice for all travellers

reviews.text: Following a 400 mile drive we checked in at 11pm with no problems, had a drink in the bar and went up to our large room for a shower before enjoying a quiet nights sleep.
reviews.title: OVERNIGHT BUSINESS TRIP TO GOSFORTH PARK

reviews.text: Breakfast was buffet style but with a wide choice and constantly restocked so remained fresh and where expected, hot.
reviews.title: Oldies Stay away for Easter

reviews.text: General point - when will Holiday Inn upgrade their beds to king size in line with the other chains?
reviews.title: Excellent Service, modern rooms and great location for where we were going!
Another good stay
reviews.text: The Hotel was very easy to find following the on-line directions.

We stayed in this hotel with our group of biker friends, but owing to the weather we were all in cars, we had lovely meals, the staff were excellent including George and Kerry who took part in our nightly quizzes, the bar area could have been a little better cosier and such like. it was also Easter which meant that weddings were taking place along with lots of children, but none of them affected us to any great extent, We were also upgraded in our room because we are platinum card holders, this was also very nice.
reviews.title: Very nice Staff and Hotel

reviews.text: I would stay here again and again, in fact we are looking at doing the trip again in October time.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: We stayed here overnight before getting early flights! Couldn't fault this hotel. Very friendly members of staff always on hand. We needed an extra blanket for our travel cot and we were quickly sorted out. Lounge bar is nice although a little pricey! Overall enjoyable
reviews.title: Too many basic faults

reviews.text: Stayed here with family for 1 night (Saturday). First thing is that this is an excellent hotel for those stag and hen weekends in Newcastle, so expect to be woke up like we all were at 3.30am by a bunch of girls who managed to sit and talk (shout) for over an hour in the room above us.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The hotel is very good but in need of updating. Our rooms were a great size but simple things could have made it so much better eg. broken bulbs replaced, a fridge for the milk, a brand of coffee that was not obviously some cheap bulk buy, bath towels that actually fit all the way round your body.
reviews.title: OK but not great

reviews.text: Stayed on business and was given a room on the ground floor which had obviously not been refurbished (other floors looked of better quality) and was very dated indeed. No free wi-fi even in communcal areas which I found a little strange in this day and age. The gym is in serious need of some new equipment and I would have been seriously disappointed if I'd paid to use it. On the plus side the staff were really friendly and are a credit to the hotel.
reviews.title: Rough

reviews.text: The staff were lovely, very helpful and friendly. We were shown where to go but on entering the changing roms, we were a bit disappointed as it was just one small communal changing area and no individual changing room. We ended up taking our turn in changing in the toilet for privacy which wasn't ideal as the floor was soaking ant the toilet wasn't flushing very well. I appreciate we are all ladies together but my friend and I prefer a bit privacy when getting changed. We walked to the swimming pool which was lovely, not very big but it was lovely and warm, the sauna and steam room were lovely too. Only criticism would be that the people in the gym were overlooking us which was a bit off putting at times. We then decided to see if we could have our hair done but were told that we would have to book for another time as the hairdressers are mobile. We weren't told this so couldn't have our hair done which was disappointing. We then had a meal in the restaurant which was lovly but I had asked for my steak to be well done and it as a bit pink in the middle so I couldn't eat much of it and the mushroom was stone cold. We were wanting to have coffee and dessert but overheard the waitres say to some other people that they could'nt serve anymore food as there was a health scare in the kitchen !! needless to say we were a bit concerned. On the whole it was a nice day and we couldn't fault the staff, they were fabulous. Thank you.
reviews.title: Spa day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a day and night and we were very impressed with the fantastically superb level of customer service. Staff were very friendly and incredibly helpful. The room was very nice, spacious and clean but pretty much like any other holiday inn elsewhere. It is in a good location to get to the city centre and there are busses near by if you don't fancy driving. There is a swimming pool but we haven't tried so cant comment on it. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Fantastic service, very nice staff

reviews.text: Recently stayed here on business, very pleasant stay. Nice friendly staff, very clean rooms, food was nice. Bar prices are a little steep so I ordered a drinks tray which was put in my room, will definitely do this on my next stay. Would highly recommend the executive suites....... Money well spent.
reviews.title: Very clean hotel

reviews.text: Id describe this as a decent hotel for midweek business travelers who dont like city centre or one night stop over for Airport access. easy to find and plenty of parking, not much in the surrounding area within walking distance and very dark unlight road not suitable for and evening stroll or whatever.
reviews.title: Decent though neither city centre or Quiet Countryside

aka: Holiday Inn Newcastle Upon Tyne Hotel
description: News update that Wi-Fi is now Free. With 154 spacious bedrooms each with an en-suite bathroom, Tea & Coffee making facilities, private dial-out telephones, remote control flatscreen TV, trouser press and hairdryer. Should you require an even higher standard of comfort, the hotel has 14 Executive bedrooms offering an excellent range of luxuries to make your stay that bit more special. In April & May 2013 our lounge, restaurant, bar and toilets have had a full refurbishment which we are very happy with and will share some new photos very soon.
